metadata.notes: Original V004 (NDX) was duplicate of V001 (National Dentex). Replaced with ROE Dental Laboratory (premium surgical specialist). Original V005 (Apex Dental Billing) was non-existent. Replaced with Vyne Dental (RCM-first platform). Original V006 (EOS Healthcare) was non-existent. Replaced with iCoreConnect (platform + service RCM). V017 and V018 both identified as Pact-One Solutions (serves both premium and basic/mid-tier markets with different service tiers). 100% vendor coverage achieved 2025-11-20.

Dentrix.evidence: Web portal (roedental.rxupload.com) with case submission, STL/PLY file uploads, status tracking. Industry standard for labs - no API integration.

Denticon.evidence: Web portal case submission, IOS scanner connections supported. No API integration documented.

differentiation_from_v007.business_model: RCM-first (comprehensive platform) vs DXC clearinghouse-first (EDI specialist)

V006.corporate_note: iCoreConnect Inc. (ICCT) filed Chapter 11 June 2025; substantially all operating assets acquired by Standard Dental Oct 1, 2025. Products continue under iCore brand.

Dentrix.evidence: Henry Schein One Authorized Software Integration - listed under Authorized Practice Operations & Management Vendors. Uses HSOne API for read/write to Dentrix database. Official API Exchange vendor.

Dentrix_Ascend.evidence: Same HSOne API Exchange authorization covers Dentrix Ascend (cloud). Single API layer shared by Dentrix on-prem and Ascend. Insurance verification and benefits integration confirmed.

OpenDental.evidence: CEO quote lists OpenDental among 'leading practice management solutions' iCore integrates with. Not listed in Open Dental's subset of Authorized API Vendors, suggesting connector/portal vs. certified API.

Eaglesoft.evidence: Named explicitly among PMSes iCore integrates with. Support docs reference 'Fully Integrated Sites' for iCoreRx listing Eaglesoft. No public authorized API vendor listing found.

Carestream.evidence: CEO quote names Carestream alongside Dentrix/Eaglesoft/OpenDental as named PMS integration. Likely connector/clearinghouse-based vs. full API.

vs_v005_vyne.associations: 200+ association agreements vs. fewer documented endorsements

differentiation_from_v005_v007.unique_value: Platform play (multiple software modules) paired with dedicated RCM service team. Deep Dentrix/Dentrix Ascend integration via HSOne API Exchange. National endorsements across many state dental societies.

V017.notes: V017 and V018 both identified Pact-One Solutions. Pact-One legitimately serves both premium (DSO/enterprise with Virtual CIO/CTO, 24/7 support) AND basic/mid-tier ($749-$800/month entry pricing, small practices). For distinct vendor diversity, consider Medix Dental IT for V017.

bulk_pricing_tiers.elite_membership: Via Elite Dental Alliance - Maximum rewards, quarterly rebates, Exclusive Savings Guarantee (spend <5% of Gross Practice Revenue or Benco refunds difference)

Lab.evidence: All 3 Lab vendors (V001, V002, V003) use portal-based file submission (STL uploads, manual Rx forms). NO full_api integrations exist in dental lab industry.
Lab.workflow_reason: Lab workflows involve physical product manufacturing. Digital files (STL scans) uploaded to portal, manual Rx forms, no real-time bidirectional sync required.

RCM.evidence: DentalXChange (V007) has full_api with OpenDental, Eaglesoft, Dentrix, Denticon. Real-time eligibility checks, claim status updates.
RCM.workflow_reason: RCM benefits from real-time eligibility verification and claim status updates. Bidirectional APIs reduce admin time by 50%.

Telephony.evidence: All 3 Telephony vendors (V008, V009, V010) require full_api. Weave, Solutionreach, RevenueWell all have real-time sync for Call Pop, schedule updates.
Telephony.workflow_reason: Telephony REQUIRES real-time sync: Call Pop (patient data displays when phone rings), appointment confirmations update PMS instantly, digital forms write back immediately.

Scheduling.evidence: All 3 Scheduling vendors (V011, V012, V013) require full_api. Lighthouse 360 (6/6 EHRs), Dental Intelligence (5/6), NexHealth (6/6 + 29 more).
Scheduling.workflow_reason: Scheduling REQUIRES real-time sync: patient self-booking writes to PMS instantly, waitlist notifications trigger immediate updates, text confirmations sync schedule status.

Clearinghouse.evidence: DentalXChange (V014): 4/6 full_api (OpenDental, Eaglesoft, Curve, Denticon), 2/6 partial_csv (Dentrix systems - competitive dynamics). NEA Fast Attach (V015): ALL partial_csv (attachment-only product, manual upload).
Clearinghouse.workflow_reason: Clearinghouse integration varies by: (1) Vendor capability (full clearinghouse vs attachment-only), (2) EHR vendor strategy (Henry Schein/Dentrix has competitive tension with DXC), (3) Product scope (standalone attachment vs integrated clearinghouse).

IT_MSP.evidence: Henry Schein TechCentral (V016): 3/7 full_api (Dentrix family - OWNS the EHR), 4/7 partial_csv (third-party EHRs). Pact-One Solutions (V017/V018): full_api across major platforms with proactive monitoring. Integration classification means EHR-specific expertise and automated monitoring, NOT traditional API integration.
IT_MSP.workflow_reason: IT/MSP 'full_api' in dental context means: automated monitoring agents, in-product support chat, preconfigured workstations, direct EHR support tickets. For owned EHRs (TechCentral owns Dentrix), deeper integration possible. Third-party EHRs receive manual troubleshooting support (partial_csv). This differs from traditional API definition.
IT_MSP.critical_note: IT/MSP integration quality is EHR ownership-dependent. Vendors owning EHRs (Henry Schein owns Dentrix) achieve full_api with owned systems but only partial_csv with competitors.

Supplies.evidence: Patterson Dental (V019): ALL partial_csv DESPITE owning Eaglesoft EHR (30,000 users). Benco Dental (V020): ALL partial_csv DESPITE Open Dental partnership. Both use separate online ordering portals (Patterson portal, Benco Painless). NO full_api direct ordering from EHR exists in dental supplies market as of November 2025.
Supplies.workflow_reason: Supplies ordering fundamentally requires separate e-commerce portal workflows: product browsing, price comparison, formulary management, approval workflows, shipping logistics. Even when distributor OWNS the EHR (Patterson owns Eaglesoft), supply ordering conducted through separate web portal, NOT integrated into EHR interface.
Supplies.critical_finding: EHR ownership does NOT guarantee integration for Supplies category. Patterson owns Eaglesoft (30,000 users) but still uses separate portal. This is category ceiling, not vendor limitation.

0.label: none
0.description: No integration. Manual data entry, phone/fax only.
0.workflow: Staff manually enters all data from paper forms or phone calls into EHR.

1.label: partial_csv
1.description: Batch file import/export, portal-based submission, manual workflows.
1.workflow: User exports CSV from EHR, uploads to vendor portal, or manually logs into separate system. No real-time sync.
1.examples: Labs (STL file upload), NEA Fast Attach (manual attachment upload), Dentrix+DentalXChange (batch CCU utility)

2.label: full_api
2.description: Real-time bidirectional API sync, certified integration partners, automatic updates.
2.workflow: Vendor system queries EHR database in real-time, updates flow both directions automatically without manual intervention.
2.examples: Telephony Call Pop, Scheduling self-booking, RCM eligibility verification, Clearinghouse claim status updates

V004_Aurident.reason: V004 (NDX) is duplicate of V001 (National Dentex). Aurident recommended as precious metal specialist lab.
V004_Aurident.action_required: Run supplement prompt to research Aurident, replace V004 in catalog

V005_Vyne_Dental.reason: V005 (Apex Dental Billing) does not exist. Vyne Dental recommended as RCM vendor.
V005_Vyne_Dental.action_required: Run supplement prompt to research Vyne Dental, add as V005 in catalog

V006_iCoreConnect.reason: V006 (EOS Healthcare) does not exist. iCoreConnect recommended as RCM platform vendor.
V006_iCoreConnect.action_required: Run supplement prompt to research iCoreConnect, add as V006 in catalog

V017_or_V018_alternatives.reason: Both V017 and V018 subagents independently identified Pact-One Solutions as optimal match. Pact-One legitimately serves both premium DSO/enterprise AND basic/mid-tier small practice markets with different service tiers ($749-$2,500+/month range).
V017_or_V018_alternatives.action_required: OPTIONAL: For distinct vendor diversity, consider replacing V017 with Medix Dental IT (premium-tier alternative with 1,000+ practices, 24/7 support, national DSO capabilities). Alternative basic/mid-tier options for V018 include Computer Geeks, Darkhorse Tech, or Digital Dental Solutions.
V017_or_V018_alternatives.current_approach: Both V017 and V018 retained as Pact-One Solutions with tier notes documenting that Pact-One serves multiple market segments. This is valid representation of market reality.
